sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均表示"伪装"或"掩饰"之意。
means: disguise ： 指改变装束或外表以掩饰自己的真面目或冒充他人。有时仅指掩饰感情、动机或意图。
mask ： 本义为"面罩"，引申"掩饰"解时，指掩饰某物的真实性质或存在的伪装。
cloak ： 指采取伪装来掩盖或隐藏真实面目或本性或企图。

word_mean: 掩盖：如无关的体征、症状、病原体等的存在掩盖了疾病的性质
在听力测定时由于另外不同频率的声音存在，致所测声音模糊不清或减小
口罩，面罩：用于遮盖、保护面部，防止灰尘吸入，或用来吸氧的装置
掩蔽：牙科用不透明物质涂布于金属假牙的表面
照相制版中用以修正画面色调和遮盖某些局部图形的模片。

sentence.Network_en: But as with other charitable bodies, these figures mask the true picture.
sentence.Network_cn: 但和其他慈善机构一样，这些数字掩盖了实情。

sentence.Network_en: This mask leaves your complexion feeling soft and supple.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种面膜能使你的皮肤变得柔软细嫩。

sentence.Network_en: Diane lit a cigarette, trying to mask her agitation.
sentence.Network_cn: 黛安娜点燃一根香烟，试图掩饰她的焦躁不安。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French masque, from Italian maschera, mascara, probably from medieval Latin masca 'witch, spectre', but influenced by Arabic masḵara 'buffoon'

encyclopedia.content: 英文解释 mask KK: [] DJ: [] n.[C] ⒈ 假面具；伪装；遮蔽物 All guests wore masks to the ball. 所有客人都戴假面具参加舞会。 ⒉ 防护面具；口罩 The nurse wore a gauge mask. 护士戴着薄纱口罩。 ⒊ （用石膏等从人的面部取下的）面模 ⒋ 掩饰，口实 He did it under the mask of charity他借慈善之名做此事。 ⒌ 化装舞会；假面具 ⒍ 戴假面具的人 A mask,in the character of an old woman,joined them. 一个戴着假面具扮

entry.def: A mask is a piece of cloth or other material, which you wear over your face so that people cannot see who you are, or so that you look like someone or something else.

example.ex: The gunman, whose mask had slipped, fled.
example.tran: 面罩掉落的持枪歹徒逃之夭夭了。

entry.tran: （防细菌或有害物质的）防护面罩,面具，口罩
entry.def: A mask is a piece of cloth or other material that you wear over all or part of your face to protect you from germs or harmful substances.

example.ex: You must wear goggles and a mask that will protect you against the fumes...
example.tran: 为了免受烟雾危害，你必须戴上护目镜和面罩。

example.ex: She wore a surgical mask and rubber gloves while she worked with the samples.
example.tran: 她处理样品的时候戴着手术口罩和橡胶手套。

entry.tran: (掩盖真实感情或性格的)伪装，掩饰
entry.def: If you describe someone's behaviour as a mask, you mean that they do not show their real feelings or character.

example.ex: His mask of detachment cracked, and she saw for an instant an angry and violent man.
example.tran: 他冷静超然的伪装破碎了，一瞬间她的面前出现了一个愤怒而又狂暴的男人。

entry.def: A mask is a thick cream or paste made of various substances, which you spread over your face and leave for some time in order to improve your skin.

example.ex: This mask leaves your complexion feeling soft and supple.
example.tran: 这种面膜能使你的皮肤变得柔软细嫩。

entry.def: If you mask your feelings, you deliberately do not show them in your behaviour, so that people cannot know what you really feel.

example.ex: Dena lit a cigarette, trying to mask her agitation.
example.tran: 德娜点燃了一根烟，试图掩饰不安。

entry.def: If one thing masks another, it prevents people from noticing or recognizing  the other thing.

example.ex: A thick grey cloud masked the sun...
example.tran: 一片厚厚的乌云遮住了太阳。

example.ex: Too much salt masks the true flavour of the food...
example.tran: 太多的盐会盖住食物本来的味道。

sentences.sentence: "they moved in under a mask of friendship"

4. a protective covering worn over the face

Sentence.sentence: Saddest of all is when children catch a glimpse of the masked fire fighter but hide because they think they have seen a monster.
Why do some children trapped in a burning building hide from masked fire fighters
He provides oxygen masks to children free of charge.
But, increasingly, this apparent diversity is becoming a mask for a new type of conformity.
It masks the fatal weaknesses of government policy
But national data masks the very large variation in the performance of individual universities.

sentences.en: Many of the dancers at the fancy dress ball wore colourful masks.
sentences.cn: 化装舞会上的许多跳舞者戴着五颜六色的面具。

means.word_mean: 用作掩饰的事物; 掩饰; 伪装

sentences.en: He conceals his worries behind a mask of nonchalance.
sentences.cn: 他装作若无其事, 借以掩饰内心的不安。

means.word_mean: 用面具遮住; 掩盖, 掩饰

sentences.en: The thief masked his face with a stocking.
This perfume won't mask the unpleasant smell.
sentences.cn: 这种香水遮不住那股难闻的气味。

jushi.english: Her sociable manner is really a mask for a very shy nature.
jushi.chinese: 她那好交际的作风,实际上是她腼腆天性的伪装。

jushi.english: He conceals his worries behind a mask of nonchalance.
jushi.chinese: 他装作若无其事,借以掩饰内心的不安。

jushi.english: Surgeons wear masks to prevent the spread of infection.
jushi.chinese: 外科医生戴着口罩以防止传染病的传播。
